intro: Eremopanax angustatus f. canalensis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eremopanax, is a rare plant species native to specific regions of Brazil. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically narrow and have a distinct venation pattern. The plant belongs to the family Araliaceae and is often found in tropical rainforest environments. Its botanical features include small, clustered inflorescences and distinctive fruit structures. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
